ICW: Kami Tolak Seluruh Konsep Dewan Pengawas KPK
07 Nov 2019, 09:21 by Dwi Andayani
Jakarta - Presiden Joko Widodo (Jokowi) mengatakan nama-nama Dewan Pengawas (Dewas) KPK masih dalam penggodokan. Indonesia Corruption Watch (ICW) mengatakan menolak seluruh konsep Dewas KPK.
"ICW pada dasarnya menolak keseluruhan konsep dari Dewan Pengawas KPK," ujar peneliti ICW Kurnia Ramadhana saat dihubungi Rabu (6/11/2019).
Kurnia mengatakan, KPK masuk dalam lembaga negara independen dengan membangun sistim pengawasan. Menurut Kurnia pengawasan tersebut telah dilakukan KPK, dengan adanya Deputi Pengawas Internal dan diawasi oleh BPK hingga DPR.
"Secara teoritik KPK, masuk dalam rumpun lembaga negara independen yang tidak mengenal konsep lembaga Dewan Pengawas. Sebab yang terpenting dalam lembaga negara independen adalah membangun sistem pengawasan, hal itu sudah dilakukan KPK dengan adanya Deputi Pengawas Internal dan Pengaduan Masyarakat. Bahkan, kedeputian tersebut pernah menjatuhkan sanksi etik pada dua pimpinan KPK, yakni Abraham Samad dan Saut Situmorang," kata Kurnia.
"Lagi pun dalam UU KPK yang lama sudah ditegaskan bahwa KPK diawasi oleh beberapa lembaga, misalnya BPK, DPR, dan Presiden. Lalu pengawasan apa lagi yang diinginkan oleh negara?" sambungnya.

ICW: We Reject the Entire Concept of the KPK Supervisory Board
Nov 7 2019, 09:21 by Dwi Andayani
Jakarta - President Joko Widodo (Jokowi) said the names of the KPK Supervisory Board (Dewas) were still being formulated. Indonesia Corruption Watch (ICW) said it rejected the entire Dewas KPK concept.
"ICW basically rejects the whole concept of the KPK Supervisory Board," ICW researcher Kurnia Ramadhana said when contacted Wednesday (11/06/2019).
Kurnia said, the KPK entered into an independent state institution by building a surveillance system. According to Kurnia, the KPK carried out the supervision, with the presence of a Deputy for Internal Supervision and supervised by the BPK to the DPR.
"Theoretically, the KPK is included in a cluster of independent state institutions that are not familiar with the concept of the Supervisory Board. The most important thing in an independent state institution is to build a monitoring system, as has been done by the KPK with the presence of a Deputy for Internal Supervision and Public Complaints. In fact, the deputy has "imposed ethical sanctions on two KPK leaders, namely Abraham Samad and Saut Situmorang," Kurnia said.
"Moreover, in the old KPK Law it was emphasized that the KPK was overseen by several institutions, such as the BPK, the DPR and the President. Then what other supervision does the state want?" he continued.
